description.narrative: “Recovery, Stability and Socio-economic Development in Libya, Phase 2 (RSSD2) - Baladiyati” T05-EUTF-NOA-LY-13 (T05.1871) Implementation period: 01 July 2021 to 30 June 2024 Kufra, Brak, Sebha, Ubari, Murzuk

sector.narrative: Build resilience to shocks and crisis

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 1.1 # of staff from the municipalities and CSOs have completed the training on selected topics (by gender) (by Municipality) 1.2 % of trained staff from the municipality with increased knowledge on training curricula (by gender) (by sector) 1.3. Number of public infrastructure built/rehabilitated operational and handed over to the local counterparts (by sector) (by Municipality) 1.4 # of beneficiary institutions that have new equipment/supplies delivered, operational (by sector) (by Municipality) 1.5 % of supplied equipment or/and rehabilitated /new infrastructure by the project where maintenance has been recognized by the government/municipalities 1.6 # of feasibility study completed (Basis of design and economic model) 1.7 Basic frameworks completed 1.8 # of preliminary screening reports and ESIA preliminary reports completed 2.1 # of people from targeted beneficiaries (SMEs, agro-businesses, local actors.) that completed capacity building activities related to economic income generating activities (by gender) (by Municipality) (by beneficiary group) 2.2 # of grants awarded to support the creation/expansion of business (number and value terms) (by Municipality) (by beneficiary group) (by sector) 3.1 % increase in knowledge by project beneficiaries as a result of social cohesion, peace building awareness raising activities (by gender) (by Municipality) 3.2 # of community members trained on social cohesion and conflict mediation (by gender) (by beneficiary group) (by Municipality) (by type of training) 3.3 # of local activities/initiatives supported towards social cohesion (by Municipality) 4.1 A joint RSSD communication and visibility boosting strategy alongside a workplan is produced for the programme and is updated regularly to adapt to evolving conditions 4.2 # of social media content (posts, campaigns, infographics and visual content) on inclusive access to basic service facilities and livelihoods opportunities produced and disseminated 4.3 # of kn

comment.narrative: 1.1 TBD 1.2 TBD 1.3 TBD 1.4 TBD 1.5 TBD 1.6 1 1.7 1 1.8 1 2.1 TBD 2.2 TBD 3.1 TBD 3.2 TBD 3.3 TBD 4.1 RSSD comms strategy and plan updated 4.2 24 4.3 5 5.1 14 5.2 4 5.3 4 5.4 1 5.5 TBD 5.6 TOR approved. At least 1 SC and 1 TC held.

The project started on 1 July 2021 with a six-months inception phase which entails preparatory activities such as coordination, and joint consultations, including work on the municipality profiles and conflict sensitivity assessments that will serve as basis for further needs assessments to inform the implementation of project specific activities.
Indicators are 0 in 2021 except for the indicator 5.4 being 1 (baseline).
A call for proposal to identify an international organization (NGO/CSO) that will conduct conflict sensitivity analysis in the 14 municipalities under RSSD 2 was prepared and expected to be launched in the last quarter of 2021. The findings of the conflict analysis will inform evidence-based interventions by AICS, UNICEF and UNDP.
During the reporting period, UNDP started the development of municipality profiles targeted by the RSSD2 Baladyiati based on desk reviews of available assessments already conducted by development partners, as well as primary data provided by national and/or local authorities. The municipality profiles will follow an outline discussed and agreed between UNDP, AICS, UNICEF and the EU Delegation and will ultimately inform UNDP, AICS and UNICEF on their respective interventions in these municipalities. These profiles will include information related to demographics, economic activity, security actors and major ongoing issues, governance arrangement, public and social services available, etc. Once completed by UNDP, the profiles will be regularly updated by UNDP, AICS and UNICEF.
In the reporting period, preparatory meetings with the mayors of the five municipalities targeted by UNDP have taken place to introduce the project and planned activities under the inception phase. In addition, the reporting period witnessed efforts from UNDP, AICS and UNICEF in the preparation of joint consultations in the municipalities where the agencies work together, with the aim of engaging all relevant stakeholders in the identification of the needs in their communities. Due to unavailability of local stakeholders (especially from the municipal council), these consultations will take place in the beginning October 2021. Two Technical Committee meetings under the “Recovery, Stability and Socio-Economic Development in Libya” were held on 16 August and 9 September in the presence of MoLG, EU, AICS, UNICEF and UNDP. Both meetings provided an opportunity to provide progress updates of the inception phase notably the activity planner, municipality weighting table and municipality needs assessments.
